Title: The thin line between cocaine and violence
Description: Cocaine has become a currency in south Colombia, and violence a common language. FRANCE 24 investigates (Report: R. Langlois, P. Mariani)

Title: Policing in Belfast
Description: After Sinn Fein's recognition of the Police Service in January, the service will be assigned a new name, new uniforms and 50 per cent of the force will comprise of Catholics. (Report: E.Irvine)

Title: State of the nation, post-Bhutto
Description: The untimely death of former Pakistani Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto has plunged the nuclear-armed Muslim nation into a deep political crisis as her political party grapples to find a new chief and the Pakistani people, another beacon of hope.

Title: Benazir Bhutto assassinated
Description: Former Pakistani prime minister Benazir Bhutto was killed in a suicide attack following a political rally in Rawalpindi, plunging the country into political crisis. (Report: J. Creedon)

Title: World leaders condemn Bhutto killing
Description: World leaders have spoken out against the assassination of Pakistani opposition leader Benazir Bhutto, with United States, India, Russia, France, Great Britain and the Vatican condemning the attack as 'abominable.'

Title: Video footage shows Ingrid Betancourt alive
Description: Footage seized from FARC rebels shows Ingrid Betancourt thin, drawn, but alive.

Title: Bringing home the overseas vote
Description: Overlooked, politically underrepresented and frequently disregarded, US citizens abroad want their voices – and their votes – heard.

Title: Illegal immigration dominates debate
Description: Republican presidential hopefuls exchanged blows Nov. 28 on immigration, religion, and gun control during a debate in St. Petersburg, Fla.

Title: Entrevista exclusiva con Hugo Chávez
Description: Desde finales de agosto, el presidente venezolano trabaja de mediador entre la guerrilla colombiana (FARC) y el gobierno colombiano. Esperado en Paris el 20 de noviembre, Hugo Chávez dió una entrevista exclusiva a FRANCE 24.

Title: Obama ahead of Clinton in polls
Description: In an ABC News/Washington Post poll released late Monday, Obama led with 30 percent among Democrats likely to attend the caucus nominating contest in Iowa, the first big hurdle in the party nominating process.

Title: Obama goes on the offensive
Description: US Senator Barack Obama openly criticised Senator Hillary Clinton, his rival for the democratic presidential nomination, saying that her vote labelling the Iranian Revolutionary Guard a terrorist organisation could be used as an excuse for war.

Title: Ingrid Betancourt: a profile
Description: Ingrid Betancourt: the "Colombian Joan of Arc".

Title: FARC order release of Betancourt aide
Description: The Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) announced the release of three hostages, including Clara Rojas, the former campaign manager of fellow hostage Ingrid Betancourt. (Report: S. Barden)

Title: French wine industry in the red
Description: The French share of global wine sales has been in the red for years, as France has seen a steady erosion of its dominant market position.

Title: The thin line between cocaine and violence
Description: Cocaine has become a currency in south Colombia, and violence a common language. FRANCE 24 investigates (Report: R.Langlois, P. Mariani)

Title: The ruins of Mogadishu
Description: After 17 years of civil war, Somalia's capital Mogadishu is fast becoming a ghost town. FRANCE 24's cameras take us inside the city. (Report: F. Berruyer)

Title: Kosovar Serbs protest Kosovo's independence
Description: Kosovar Serbs took to the streets in Mitrovica today to protest against the imminent independence of Kosovo ahead of a UN Security Council meeting on the status of the Serbian province.

Title: Castro's announcement timed deliberately?
Description: Fidel Castro has hinted at possible retirement. Scroll down to read an analysis by Jeannette Habel, specialist on Cuba.

Title: Musharraf ends emergency rule
Description: Pakistani president Pervez Musharraf lifted the national state of emergency on Saturday. This comes on the heels of a suicide bomb that killed 5 in the northwest of the country.

Title: Bhutto, Sharif target Musharraf
Description: Former Prime Ministers Benazir Bhutto and Nawaz Sharif have hit the presidential campaign trail. They are concentrating their fire on the incumbent president, Pervez Musharraf. (Report: N. Rushworth)

Title: Losing ground in the genetic revolution
Description: Genetically modified crops: danger, menace or opportunity? Politicians, researchers and GM industrials are discussing GM crops in France.

Title: Uribe agrees to 'meeting zone' for hostage talks
Description: Colombian President Alvaro Uribe agrees to create a demilitarized "meeting zone" to enable talks on a hostage-swap with Marxist FARC rebels.

Title: Presidential vote delayed until Dec. 11
Description: The parliamentary vote for a new Lebanese president has been postponed for the seventh time.

Title: Life after Guantanamo
Description: Saudi Arabia tests a rehabilitation centre for former Guantanamo detainees and jihadist fighters. (Report: Alaa al-Hathloul, Johan Bodin)

Title: Presidential vote delayed until Dec. 11
Description: The parliamentary vote for a new Lebanese president has been postponed for the seventh time.

Title: Supermarkets in India - will they work?
Description: Big supermarket chains – foreign and domestic – are taking aim at the Indian market: India’s growing middle class. But in a land where freshness is king, will it work?

Title: FARC rebels warn Sarkozy against criticism
Description: Colombian guerrillas told French President Nicolas Sarkozy on Thursday to stop criticizing them if he hopes to gain the release of hostages including French-Colombian politician Ingrid Betancourt.

Title: Ask our correspondent
Description: What is the meaning of the rebellion led by Tutsi former General Laurent Nkunda? What role does Rwanda play in this conflict? France 24's correspondent Arnaud Zajtman in North-Kivu responds.

Title: The rape of Kivu
Description: Since the start of the year 1,400 women have been raped in the North Kivu region, according to the UN, and a third of them were underage.  (Report: A. Zajtman)

Title: Army retakes rebels stronghold
Description: The Congolese army has retaken Mushake, in eastern Congo, a strategic village that was serving as the headquarters of Laurent Nkunda.

Title: Supermarkets in India - will they work?
Description: Big supermarket chains – foreign and domestic – are taking aim at the Indian market: India’s growing middle class. But in a land where freshness is king, will it work?

Title: Ingrid Betancourt's letter
Description: Ingrid Betancourt's relatives have released large extracts from the 12-page letter they received from the French-Colombian hostage on Friday. You can read the original French text below.

Title: A leader of the Burmese resistance
Description: Last September, the Burmese people, led by a legion of Buddhist monks, defied the military junta. We meet one of their leaders, who has been on the run for two months, in a secret sanctuary on the Thai-Burmese border. (Report: C. Payen)

Title: The man who could be president
Description: As the Lebanese Parliament continues postponing the vote to elect a new president, army chief Michel Sleiman has emerged as the likely candidate for the presidency.

Title: Suleiman backed for Lebanese presidency
Description: Lebanon's Western-backed governing majority has announced that it will back army chief General Michel Suleiman as a compromise candidate for the vacant presidency.

Title: Pro-Hezbollah sit-in: first anniversary
Description: Hundreds of Hezbollah supporters in Beirut on Saturday marked the first anniversary of their open-ended sit-in to bring down the government. (Report: S. Barden)

Title: The man who could be president
Description: As the Lebanese Parliament continues postponing the vote to elect a new president, army chief Michel Sleiman has emerged as the likely candidate for the presidency.

Title: A glimmer of hope for Lebanon
Description: The political vacuum in Lebanon may soon be filled. Chief Army General Michel Suleiman has emerged as the front-runner for the presidency, after the largest bloc in the Lebanese parliament decided to drop its veto.

Title: Delusion of Zoe's Ark
Description: Stopped from bringing back over 100 children from Darfur, whom they claimed were orphans, six charity members now risk 20 years of forced labour in Chad.

Description: The political vacuum in Lebanon may soon be filled. Chief Army General Michel Suleiman has emerged as the front-runner for the presidency, after the largest bloc in the Lebanese parliament decided to drop its veto.

Title: Two candidates emerge from Lebanon deadlock
Description: Lebanon's presidential election was delayed again as rival political factions failed to agree on a new president. Leading candidates today are Michel Edde and Robert Ghanem.

Title: Lebanon faces presidential void
Description: Lebanon's ruling coalition has will vote to elect a new head of state, while the Hezbollah-led opposition may boycott. Chances of reaching a consensus are dwindling before election deadline at midnight. (Report: C. Casali)

Description: As investors continue to worry about the sub-prime lending crisis, millions of ordinary Americans are feeling the punch. (Report: S.Claudet, H.Frade)

Description: Lebanon's ruling coalition has will vote to elect a new head of state, while the Hezbollah-led opposition may boycott. Chances of reaching a consensus are dwindling before election deadline at midnight. (Report: C. Casali)

Title: Patriarch submits list of presidential candidates
Description: The parliament speaker and the head of the majority started mulling over Nasrallah Sfeir's list of potential candidates to take over for Syrian-backed President Emil Lahoud on Nov 21.

Title: Meeting Abu Tayeb
Description: In the heart of Taliban-controlled Afghanistan, FRANCE 24's Claire Billet meets Abu Tayeb, a Taliban special brigade commander. (13 min. report)

Title: The shady business of football
Description: Fixed games, durty money, corruption... Is football drifting into mafia business?

Title: Patriarch submits list of presidential candidates
Description: The parliament speaker and the head of the majority started mulling over Nasrallah Sfeir's list of potential candidates to take over for Syrian-backed President Emil Lahoud on Nov 21.

Title: Lebanese presidential election postponed
Description: The presidential election, initially scheduled for Nov. 12, will be delayed until Nov. 21. The paliamentary session to elect a president has already been postponed twice.

Description: Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez spoke to FRANCE 24's Pascale Mariani and Roméo Langlois about his negotiations with FARC leaders on the release of hostages.

Title: Heading towards an institutional void
Description: The Lebanese are holding their breath. The country is anticipating with dread the crucial date of November 21 - the date of the upcoming elections.

Description: The presidential election, initially scheduled for Nov. 12, will be delayed until Nov. 21. The paliamentary session to elect a president has already been postponed twice.

Description: French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner travelled to Beirut on Monday to urge Lebanese parties to come to an agreement ahead of the presidential election scheduled for Nov. 21st.

Title: Ten days inside Iraqi Kurdistan
Description: With 100,000 Turkish troops massing near the border, Iraq’s Kurds find themselves once again at the centre of international tension. (Report: L. Menget and F. Berruyer)

Title: Bhutto braves police - unsuccessfully
Description: Police in the Pakistani capital of Islamabad prevented opposition leader Benazir Bhutto's car from leaving her residence to lead a mass rally protesting President Musharraf's declaration of emergency.

Title: Suu Kyi meets democracy party, first time in 3 years
Description: Detained Burma opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi met the leaders of her National League for Democracy party for the first time in three years on Friday, amid hopes that talks with the junta may start soon.

Title: UN chief wants extra choppers for Darfur team
Description: UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon has called for extra transport and helicopters for the UN-AU peacekeeping force for Darfur, while waiting for final approval for the deployment from the Sudanese government.

Title: Gambari: door open for "substantive dialogue"
Description: UN special envoy Ibrahim Gambari says a path to "substantive dialogue" between Burma's junta and detained opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi is now open, at the end of his six-day visit to the country.

Title: Data under scrutiny
Description: Since 9/11, European airlines and banks share information on their customers with US. Some say that the US is using this data in an economic war against Europe.

Title: Afghanistan: fearless under fire
Description: FRANCE 24's Nicolas Ransom and Mathieu Mabin spent a fortnight following the French commandos in Afghanistan.

Title: Burma releases 46 prisoners ahead of UN visit
Description: Burmese authorities have released 46 prisoners originally arrested during the unrest in August and September, ahead of UN envoy Ibrahim Gambari's visit to the country on Saturday.

Title: Burma releases 46 prisoners ahead of UN visit
Description: Burmese authorities have released 46 prisoners originally arrested during the unrest in August and September, ahead of UN envoy Ibrahim Gambari's visit to the country on Saturday.

Title: 200 monks demonstrate in Burma
Description: Approximately 200 monks have staged a protest in Pakkoku, central Burma, the first such protest since the military government's brutal repression of the pro-democracy movement last month.

Title: Darfur lawyer wins European rights prize
Description: Sudanese lawyer Salih Mahmoud Osman has received the prestigious Sakharov Prize for his defence of human rights. Osman has provided free legal aid to victims in his country for more than two decades.

Title: Are Arab economies on the march?
Description: Arab companies seem to have problems as none of them are among the world top 100.

Title: Presidential vote delayed in Lebanon
Description: Lawmakers from the ruling coalition and the Hezbollah-led opposition have until November 24 to pick a candidate to succeed the current pro-Syrian head of state Emile Lahoud.

Description: FRANCE 24's Lucas Menget gives an inside report on Buddhist monks in Burma sent into hiding by the military government's crackdown.

Title: Vying for the elections
Description: Maronite Christians from both sides of the political divide in Lebanon are running for presidency.

Title: Bahout: "Chances of a compromise are slim"
Description: Joseph Bahout, expert on Middle East politics, explains why chances of reaching a compromise over a possible candidate are slim.

Title: Clashes continue in DR Congo
Description: Fighting continued near Mushaki in the Democratic Republic of Congo's Nord-Kivu province after the army pushed in vain to try to take a town back from a renegade former general, the military said.

Title: Crackdown in the heart of Burma
Description: In November 2008, the Association of International Broadcasting (AIB) awarded two prizes to France 24: for reporting in Burma in October 2007 by Cyril Payen, Solomon Kane and Paul Rush and for our multimedia approach to news coverage.

Title: In a rebel-held village
Description: Mushake is a small town in the mountains of Eastern Congo. It is controlled by the rebel general Laurent Nkunda. (Report: A.Zajtman)

Title: Official press tries to discredit monks
Description: Two weeks after the Burmese government cracked down on demonstrators, the country's state-run press is finally talking about the protests - calling the monks impostors and pornographers.

Title: Burma in shock after repression
Description: A week after Burma's ruling junta cracked down on nationwide protests, people are still in shock. Most monks are in hiding, and the streets of Rangoon are deserted.

Title: Life in restive Peshawar
Description: France 24's Franck Berruyer and Laure de Matos travelled for ten days between Peshwar and Islamabad covering the restive North West Frontier Province.

Title: A sinister spy story
Description: Pakistan's secretive ISI is one of the world's best-known, little-known spy agencies. But can it control the Frankenstein monsters it has nurtured?

Title: Brazil: the new agricultural force
Description: Brazil has emerged as the new great agricultural power. The country has gained market shares as a producer of cotton, sugar, soy, and tobacco. And it's not about to stop - currently Brazil uses only eight per cent of its land for agriculture.

Title: Mai Mai, a new militia in North Kivu
Description: A new mysterious group that calls itself "Mai Mai" has taken up arms and struck new alliances against the troops of dissident General Laurent Nkunda. (Report: A. Zajtman)

Title: Is Musharraf in the hot seat?

Description: Pakistan's Supreme Court throws President Musharraf's re-election bid into doubt a day after Musharraf's power-sharing agreement with ex-PM Benazir Bhutto.

Title: Burma: junta releases over 200 monks and nuns
Description: More than 200 monks and nuns were released in the early hours of Wednesday, saying that they were subjected to verbal, not physical, abuse during their interrogations. (Report: L. Kammourieh)

Title: Al-Rachid: 'the US have tried everything'
Description: Loulouwa al-Rachid, an expert in Iraqi politics, discusses the surge of sectarian violence in Iraq.

Title: Chinese media silent over Burma crisis
Description: While there's been little discussion of the Burmese crackdown in the Chinese press, bloggers outside the country condemns it.

Title: Images of dead monk emerge
Description: As UN special envoy Ibrahim Gambari waits to meet the country’s leader, images smuggled out of the country appear to document the brutal crackdown on monks.

Title: Rebels claim attack in Southeast
Description: As the gov't moves troops toward protest-hit Rangoon, ethnic Karen rebels are stepping up their attacks.

Title: Images of dead monk emerge
Description: As UN special envoy Ibrahim Gambari waits to meet the country’s leader, images smuggled out of the country appear to document the brutal crackdown on monks.

Title: Repression imposes silence on southern Burma
Description: In Rangoon, the demonstrations continue and the repression hardens but elsewhere, the situation is different. So describes Cyril Payen, France 24 Correspondent, in a village in the south of the country.

Title: Portrait: Aung San Suu Kyi
Description: A portrait of Aung San Suu Kyi ,the woman who has become an international symbol of heroic and peaceful resistance in Burma (Report: E. Boyer King).

Description: A portrait of Aung San Suu Kyi ,the woman who has become an international symbol of heroic and peaceful resistance in Burma (Report: E. Boyer King).

Title: Senior Buddhist monk calls for democratic Burma
Description: France 24 talks to one of Burma's most famous monks, Rambo. He urges the monks to go on with their struggle(Report: Cyril Payen)

Title: UN Council authorises EU force for Chad
Description: The U.N. Security Council authorised on Tuesday a European Union peacekeeping force and U.N. police to help protect civilians suffering from the spillover violence from neighboring Darfur.

Description: Troops and riot police took up positions outside at least six big activist monasteries in Rangoon on Wednesday as Burma's junta tried to prevent monks leading new protest marches against military rule.

Title: The vulture funds
Description: These funds are accused of making money by buying the debt of poor nations cheaply.

Title: Tens of thousands flee Kivu region
Description: Despite a UN-negociated ceasefire between the DRC army and renegade troops loyal to ex-general Laurent Nkunda on Sept. 6, 30.000 villagers fled the region of Saké. (Report : A.Zajtman).

Title: Concern over eastern Congo violence mounts
Description: After a recent round of heavy fighting in the region, a senior EU official urged greater cooperation between fractious neighbours Rwanda and the DRC.

Title: FARC hostage families turn to Chavez
Description: Relatives of Colombians kidnapped by Marxist guerrillas -- including French-Colombian politician Ingrid Betancourt's mother -- call on Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez to help break the hostage deadlock.

Title: About bio-Piracy
Description: Developing nations are accuse multinational companies from the North of using plants without paying anything in return.

Title: UN-African Union force in Darfur authorised
Description: The UN Security Council voted unanimously Tuesday to authorize the deployment of a joint African Union-UN force in Sudan's strife-torn Darfur region.

Title: Gaza Strip residents flock to beaches

Title: Gaza: Hamas in control
Description: Hamas has scored points after the liberation of British journalist Alan Johnston. In the Gaza Strip, partisans of Hamas patrol the streets since they took control of the area.

Description: High-level talks in Paris aim to bring together the countries involved in the Darfur conflict   to discuss a political solution and humanitarian issues.

Title: Chad-Sudan: a fractious border
Description: The border between Chad and Sudan streches more than 800 miles. The Sudanese and Chadian armies have engaged in a war of attrition. Special correspondents: Sophie Claudet and Virgine Herz.

Title: Abu Shouk camp in El Fasher
Description: In El Fasher 150 000 refugees have settled in the 3 largest camps of the region. The oldest camp, Abu Shouk, is where most of the Fur tribesmen have sought refuge. (Report: S.Claudet, V.Herz)

Title: The fight to keep the peace
Description: Over 200,000 people have been killed in the Darfur crisis. A force of 7,000 troops in an area the size of France, the African Union are struggling to keep the peace. Special correspondents: Sophie Claudet and Virginie Herz.

Title: Darfur: Q&A
Description: FRANCE 24's Sophie Claudet and Virginie Herz are travelling to the Darfur region of Sudan to report on the conflict. If you have questions, send them in by clicking 'React.'

Description: Colombian President Alvaro Uribe on Friday welcomes G8 support for his initiative to free hostages held by left-wing rebels, but a guerrilla leader released from prison to try to negotiate a deal warns that any agreement remains elusive.

Description: Colombia came to a standstill earlier as hundreds of thousands massed on the streets to protest kidnappings by FARC guerrillas.

Description: Cybercriminality is increasing as it's becoming more lucrative. The FBI estimates that American companies alone lose more than 70 billion

Description: Former Protestant and Catholic rivals Ian Paisley and Martin McGuinness have been sworn in as Northern Ireland's first minister and deputy.

Description: Ailing Cuban leader Fidel Castro has attacked the US over its plans to develop biofuels. In his first editorial since having surgery in July, Castro maintained that the US would deprive millions of nutrition.

Description: Northern Ireland has faced decades of violence,leading to to the deaths of 3,600 people. A look back on this troubled period. (Report: N.Germain)

Title: Senegal crashes out of Nations Cup

Description: The Irish Republican party Sinn Fein has taken a historic decision in recognising the Police Service of Northern Ireland.
